    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public void handle(java.lang.Object controller,
                   java.lang.reflect.Field field,
                   FXRequired validation)
        The default validation handling method takes a controller object, a field and the annotation, and does the following things:
        1. Query the actual control (the field value) from the controller.
        2. Get the validation handler ("validator") from the annotation of the field, then create an instance of the validation handler.
        3. Register validator with the control in the ValidatorService
        4. Register controller with the control in the ValidatorService
        5. Add event listeners that call the validate() method of the validation handler.
        Specified by:
        handle in interface com.aeonium.javafx.actions.annotations.AnnotationHandler<FXRequired>
        Parameters:
        controller - The controller of the fxml UI
        field - The field referencing the UI control
        validation - The annotation.

      • mark

        public static void mark(javafx.scene.control.Control control,
                        boolean valid,
                        java.lang.String errormessage)
        Mark the given control according to the validation success as validated or failed. Currently, this is done by adding or removing stye classes.
        Parameters:
        control - The UI control
        valid - Whether the input was valid or not, i.e., whether the input state of the control is valid or not.
        errormessage - The error message to display if the control's input is not valid. May be left to null if no message should be displayed.

      • doValidate

        private void doValidate(FXAbstractValidator validator,
                        javafx.scene.control.Control control,
                        java.lang.annotation.Annotation fxValidation)
